When the papal bull reached Luther, he said: "I despise and attack it, as impious, false. . . . It is Christ Himself who 
                                                                           142
is condemned therein. . . . I rejoice in having to bear such ills for the best of causes. Already I feel greater liberty in my heart; for at last I know that the pope is antichrist, and that his throne is that of Satan himself."--D'Aubigne, b. 6, ch. 9.
